'''Earissë''' was the daughter of [[Lindo]] and the wife of [[Ælfwine]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. She was the mother of [[Heorrenda]] and [[Hlúdwine]].<ref name=Ear>{{PE|15}}, "[[Names and Required Alterations]]", Appendix, ''Text XI'' and ''Text XII'', p. 18</ref>

Earissë only appears in two of the notes in the ''[[Notebook C]]'',<ref name=Ear/> a small pocket-book which [[Tolkien]] used for notes and suggestions while writing ''The Book of Lost Tales''.<ref>{{LT2|V}}, p. 254</ref>

Nothing else is known about her.

== Etymology ==
The name ''Earissë'' is in [[Qenya]], probably being a phonological imitation of the English name '''''Edith''''' and its [[Old English]] form ''Eadgyth''. ''Eadgyth'' consists of the elements ''éad'' ("riches, prosperity, good fortune, happiness") + ''gyth'', a form of ''gúð'' ("combat, battle, war").<ref name=Ear/>

The first element of the name ''Earissë'' might be ''[[ea(r)]]/[[earen]](-d)'' ("eagle"), the second being ''[[-ssë]]'', a feminine name ending occurring in several other names in the early [[legendarium]].<ref name=Ear/>

An earlier form of the name was ''Eadissë''.<ref name=Ear/>
